Got DBD on sale -40%. About a year ago.
Not a bad game! Even tho I played DBD before, the mobile version, I never got my hands on the PC version as my laptop were usually too old.
The match-making was OK to some point, but it got worse as I got higher ranks.
Per total the game 'Moves good, feels good', as Elvis Presley would say.
Get this game if it's on sale. It's worth the money. Also if you want to get desperate and rage-quit frequently.
By the way, do something to get Jason Voorhees as a killer; I'd pay for that.
Revert the hack back now.

суппер

The Good

It's a one of a kind game. It's a lot of fun, and sometimes the buggy jank is entertaining. Being able to play survive with friends is a bunch of fun, and there are a fair amount of killers that are actually enjoyable to both play and play against. I've put in over a 1,000 hours into the game over a year and a half. Occasionally they implement some nice changes, and the updated maps look really good! Adding in unique music to most of the killers has been really cool as well. Though, some of the music hurts my ears to listen to and I can't stand (Doctor and Billy).


The Bad

The devs don't listen to their own player base, and implement things nobody wants, while ignoring issues that need addressing for seemingly months at a time. For example, nobody wants mmr. Nobody. This game is not meant to be competitive. It does not work well enough and is not consistent enough to warrant mmr anyways. It's also annoying as killer not being able to switch to another killer while waiting in a lobby for an unknown amount of time. I want to be able to spend some bloodpoints on other killers, y'know. The only way I could see competitive matchmaking working, is if players could submit maps that wouldn't have any rng, and people could load and play those maps in Kill Your Friends. That would be pretty cool, but I don't think Behaviour is capable of implementing that (at least not anytime soon).

DC penalties are trash. "Oh, you're having a bad time being tunneled and camped and just want out? 5 minute ban FUCK YOU!" or "Oh, the game crashed or your internet went out? Clearly you intentionally disconnected. Fuck you!" Sure, I've DC'd in order to give the last survivor hatch before, and I've even eaten the 5 minute ban to do so. But all in all it just punishes you for things out of your control most of the time. Yes, you'd see more DC's against killers who were playing fairly, but now people will also just die on first hook. So in effect nothing has changed for the better. It just wastes the time of players who get disconnected for bad internet or when DBD or steam fucks something up. They should remove DC penalties completely.

Killer changes are sometimes ok, but sometimes suck and are unecessary. Bubba's change turned him from a weak killer to a decent killer, and was honestly a good move. Billy's change on the other hand made no sense. He was a completely balanced killer base kit, the most they might of had to do was change some addons. Nurse changes were ok. I haven't noticed too much of a difference between the rare good nurse getting a 4k within 5 or 6 minutes, but everybody is ok with a good nurse winning anyways. Why change Billy when nobody asked, when they could give Spirit some counterplay, or remove Iridescent Head from Huntresses addons? The things players actually want.

As far as the UI goes, nobody asked for a change, and the change we got is terrible. The only good thing about it is the hook counters, which are kind of neat, but that's a minor convenience thing we could do in our heads anyways. Good for solo queues I guess. The rest of it is awful. I don't want to look around my entire screen just to get my information. beforehand it was just right. On the left side you had your survivor and gen info, and on the right you had the perk info. That's all you needed. Why the hell did the devs go "Well, we have some busted addons that players dislike, and some issues with killers that make them unfun to play against, but since that's a lot of work we'll just change something that nobody asked for." just why? I don't know how long I can play this with the shitty UI. It's so fucking bad. Hopefully they'll change that back soon. Being able to scale the UI is a good change though.

I hate breakable walls. The only map breakable walls are good or fit thematically are on Dead Dawg Saloon. When they came out on that map I thought they were a neat gimmick that added something new just for that map. Now that Behavior adds them to every single map they update and they are disgusting. Maybe they'd be cool if survivors had to do an animation to build them, but I dislike seeing them on every single map. They basically make some loops horrible for killer unless they're broken down, and then they make the loops really weak for survivor when they do get broken. So either way they're just annoying and detract from the game. They should remove them from all the maps except Dead Dawg Saloon or make survivors invest time into building them.

PTBs don't do much I guess. They still let out The Twins despite them being buggy, and even then the twins are not fun to go against. There isn't much you can do against Victor, and their play style is just not fun to go against. I haven't played them as killer, but I wouldn't want to anyways. I don't know what to change about them to make them fun, other than maybe slowing Victor down, or he takes much longer to respawn after he gets killed.


Really, the devs just need to listen to their players and work with us, considering they clearly don't play their own game the same amount or the same way the rest of us do. I'm an experienced player but not a stellar one. I'm probably about average in terms of skill and knowledge for the amount of time I've played this game. Still, if the devs reached out I'd be willing to help them. Until they start working with their players I will not recommend this game to people.

今回のアプデがとにかく最高です。UI・モーションの変更が個性的すぎて意味がわかりません。そして大型アプデによる数々のバグ。最高です。まともにプレイすることもできません。私自身はこのゲームが大好きなので、強くおすすめしたいゲームではありますが、今は引退したいです。新しい要素にも慣れていくことも必要かもしれませんが、さすがに修正していただきたいです。今回の改悪が改良されることを願って。

↑から４か月経ちました。改良されたのか、慣れたのか。いずれにせよ、最高に面白いゲームです。強くお勧めします。
O jogo é ótimo. Não é fácil de começo mas depois de um tempo você pega o jeito.

Game is kind of unplayable right now with the last mid-chapter 4.5.0 update. Movement changes were not really necessary and as it seems like it ruined the fun and how was it before. Before this update, everything was alright only a few small global fixes needed but now this completely puts the game at "not playable", at least for Veteran players or players who played before. The HUD/UI changes I guess I can get used to that but I didn't think that was necessary for this game too. I hope to see better. I would recommend this game before the update went live which I hoped it would never go live but it did. This is not a thing that will make me quit the game because I really do like it, it's just sad seeing some stuff go to waste just for a few 'not so good' changes. Hope you do better, Dead by Daylight. And fix the hitboxes, please.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

They did fix the hitboxes and well, they did do things to this game, so now I have no problem with the game. Only the MMR system. With movements I've gotten used to them.

I'm just really sad that my all time favourite game since 2016 became such a mess and a dev team that don't care about the feedback of the playerbase at all ;(

Here i am, writing this after 3,5k hours of playtime...

Such a fun and enjoyable game, ruined by 2 Patches that changed the feeling, the fun and literally everything.

If you new to dbd.... go and buy this game, i think it will be really funny cause you will never know how much more fun it was before. But i can tell you this: The Devs of this game will disappoint you later, i will 100% guarantee that.

Everyone in this community enjoyed the good and the bad moments over the past 4 years. Even if every patch had at least 2+ bugs, new changes or balances nobody liked, we still played this game... cause it was fun, laughable when someone glitched sometimes.

But at this point, this game is in the worst state it ever been, since they realeased the hag and couldn't publish a new chapter for almost 6 months.

The devs literally missed every chance to make the community happy. 
They are the most selfish devs i have ever seen.

This has been one of my favourite games for years now, I’ve clocked up over 1000 hours, but after the update a few days ago I no longer find this game playable. The UI is horrific, it’s like playing on a mobile game and the new survivor movement feels so stiff and takes away from the original gameplay that I fell in love with. Unless the game reverts back to how it was or gets some kind of change I don’t find this game playable anymore. They listened to none of the players negative feedback and made all the changes anyway despite being aware no one wanted or liked the changes. It honestly saddens me that one of my favorite games is now completely ruined because developers choose not to listen to feedback we are providing them with.

Gra ma 5 lat a jest więcej błędów niż na początku.Po tym jak dbd na epicu za darmo było, to jest wiecej dzieci które trooluja,nie umieją grac,campią lub tooneloją a i tak nie dostana zadnej kary. Od 2021 każda postać która wyjdzie jest op, przykład magik, napierdal# 50 nożami a musi trafić tylko 12 razy (chyba) żeby powalił na ziemie surva.Nie naprawiaja wiekszosci bledow i w przeprosiny daja BP a potem ten sam blad jest jeszcze przez tydzien.Optymalizajcja jest koszmarna.Zeby zagrac w dbd w 60 fps musisz miec lepsze specyfikacje niz zalecane.Wedlug Behaviour w grze powinienem miec przynajmniej 60 fps a mam okolo 45.Gra z kazdym miesiacem jest coraz gorsza wiec jezeli nic nie naprawicie w tej grze to vhs was przegoni w 3 tygodnie.
